thread.title: AP Top Extended Financial Headlines At 1:32 p.m. EDT
thread.title_full: AP Top Extended Financial Headlines At 1:32 p.m. EDT

title: AP Top Extended Financial Headlines At 1:32 p.m. EDT
text:
Reprint 
Citi to refund $700 million to customers, pay $70 million in fines, for illegal card practices Unemployment rates fell in 21 US states in June, held down by shrinking workforce US stocks move lower after several companies including IBM report disappointing results World mayors at Vatican: Climate change is real, man-made and must be contained Airlines turning to biofuels to meet emissions rules, capitalize on growth in air travel United Technologies posts lower 2Q revenue, profit; cuts revenue outlook on aerospace, Otis Bristol-Myers says drug for treatment-resistant HIV gets incentives to speed up development European regulators approve Amgen's breakthrough cholesterol drug Repatha Chesapeake Energy eliminates its annual dividend of 35 cents per share Verizon Communications beats 2Q profit expectations, but misses revenue forecasts Copyright 2014 Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. Check Out Our Best Services for Investors 
Portfolio Manager Jim Cramer and Director of Research Jack Mohr reveal their investment tactics while giving advanced notice before every trade. Product Features:
